Subject: A question regarding NAA for Database
Description:
Hi Support,

Here is a question from client side regarding NAA for database,Since the client doesn't want to enable DB auditing on their SQL server.
Could  SQL server activities directly be scaned and imported from NAM into DB by NAA ?
Look forward to hearing from you.

Jimmy
What_We_Know__c:
They want to know if it is possible to audit DB with enabling Auditing on SQL server.

Currently it is not possible.

https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/AccessAnalyzer_12.0/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Requirements/Target/DatabaseSQL.htm
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/AccessAnalyzer_12.0/page/Content/Config/SQLServer/Activity.htm
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/ActivityMonitor_8.0/page/Content/ActivityMonitor/Admin/MonitoredHosts/Add/SQLServer.htm
Solution_Comment__c:
Query
You wanted to know if there was a way to audit SQL DB without enabling DB auditing.

Answer
As per the documentation shared with you, this is currently not possible.
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/AccessAnalyzer_12.0/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Requirements/Target/DatabaseSQL.htm
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/AccessAnalyzer_12.0/page/Content/Config/SQLServer/Activity.htm
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/ActivityMonitor_8.0/page/Content/ActivityMonitor/Admin/MonitoredHosts/Add/SQLServer.htm
